title: (USA) Senior, Data Analyst - BI and Reporting, Epic
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Business intelligence developers (BIDs) create analytics content for end users and third parties who require Epic data. The BID is responsible for all aspects of analytics solution delivery. The scope of their responsibility ranges from understanding and documenting the needs of data consumers to creating, testing, and delivering SQL-based and non-SQL-based solutions to meet those needs. The BID will specialize by Epic application or consumer group (Revenue Cycle, Access, Ambulatory Clinical, Inpatient Clinical). The BID will own consumer communication and content development.You'll Sweep Us Off Our Feet If YouHave at least 5+ years of experience in Epic, specifically in the Ambulatory space.Comprehensive understanding of data analysis, reporting, proficient in Cogito SQL, Reporting WorkBench, SlicerDicer, Radar Dashboards, and PowerBIProven experience in translating business requirements into innovative data solutions that drive growth and leveraging data to inform business strategy and process design.Strong collaboration skills, adept at working in a team-focused environment and liaising with various organizational departments to meet their data needs.Experienced in maintaining data integrity through regular quality checks, troubleshooting data-related issues, and providing timely resolutions.What You'll Bring Data Source Identification : Ideal BID candidate is well-versed in end-user workflows, as well as domain-specific operational concepts. Requires knowledge of Functional business domain and scenarios; Categories of data and where it is held; Business data requirements; Database technologies and distributed datastores (e.g. SQL, NoSQL); Data Quality. Help identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. Perform initial data quality checks on extracted data.  Tech. Problem Formulation : Ideally, BIDs design and create analytics solutions based on an in-depth knowledge of operational system usage. This level of knowledge requires a deep understanding of system build, end user workflows, and patterns of use. The best BIDs have both the technical skills required to design and write reports and the operational knowledge to help them understand what report consumers need to see. Advanced Analytics Techniques: Proficiency in applying advanced analytics and statistical techniques, including regression analysis, time series forecasting, machine learning algorithms, and optimization models, to solve complex business problems. Understanding Business Context : The BID should be familiar with Epic applications and database structures. Understand the Epic data models. The BID must have the ability to understand data structures that could benefit the entire data environment. For financial reporting: Prior experience working with an AR system is desirable, but not required. For clinical reporting: Prior experience working with an EMR system is desirable, but not required.  Data Visualization : Experience shadowing end users to gain an understanding of user workflows and how to present the data users need in a meaningful and useful way. Requires knowledge of Visualization guidelines and best practices for complex data types; Configuring and testing Epic-released and Foundation System content for all applications (Reporting Workbench, SlicerDicer data models, Radar dashboards, Cogito SQL); Generate appropriate graphical representations of data and model outcomes. Understand customer requirements to design appropriate data representation for complex data sets. Build compelling stories based on context to integrate multiple pieces of information into cohesive insights. Present to and influence diverse audiences using the appropriate data visualization frameworks and conveys clear messages through deep business and stakeholder understanding. Customize communication style based on stakeholders and leverages relationships to drive behavioral change. Guide and mentor junior associates on story types, structures, and techniques based on context.  Data Analysis : Configuring and testing Epic-released and Foundation System content for all applications, including Reporting Workbench, SlicerDicer data models, Radar dashboards, Cogito SQL. Creating content to display Epic data from Chronicles, Clarity, and Caboodle. Writing SQL and configuring Radar settings for custom SQL metrics. Modifying existing reports, as necessary. Distributing analytics content to data consumers. Reviewing peer reports for validity. Maintaining the Analytics Catalog and associated metadata records. Testing analytics build in a specified testing environment and volume testing in live environments. Reviewing upgrade documentation related to Clarity and Caboodle features and determining how to implement the changes. BIDs might also be responsible for building and maintaining: Cubes, Extracts, SlicerDicer custom filters, Third-party BI tools, Custom Epic data in Caboodle). Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 2 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Option 3: 4 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)Primary Location...2608 Se J St, Bentonville, AR 72716-3724, United States of America

title: Principal, Data Scientist (Pricing)
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Walmart Global Tech is seeking a talented and experienced Principal Data Scientist specializing in Pricing Algorithms to lead our efforts in developing sophisticated pricing models and strategies . As a Principal Data Scientist , you will play a critical role in driving innovation and optimizing revenue through the application of advanced statistical and machine learning techniques. You will lead a team of data scientists and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement pricing algorithms that maximize profitability and drive business growth.About TeamOur Merchandise AI Team within Applied AI group is the driving force behind our retail and e-commerce success, leveraging cutting-edge AI and machine learning techniques to optimize every aspect of our merchandising strategy. With a diverse blend of expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and retail operations , our team pioneers innovative solutions across the merchandising lifecycle, from demand forecasting and assortment planning to pricing optimization. We're dedicated to building algorithms that empower stakeholders throughout the organization to make informed, data-driven decisions, ensuring that we stay ahead of the curve in an ever-evolving retail landscape.What You'll DoStrategic Leadership: Provide strategic leadership and technical expertise in the development and implementation of pricing algorithms and models. Define the vision, roadmap, and priorities for pricing optimization initiatives. Algorithm Development: Lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced pricing algorithms using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques, including but not limited to regression analysis, demand forecasting, dynamic pricing, and reinforcement learning. Code Review: Conduct thorough code reviews of pricing algorithms and related software components developed by the team. Ensure adherence to best practices, coding standards, and optimization techniques. Provide constructive feedback and mentorship to team members to enhance code quality and maintainability. Data Analysis and Insights: Utilize large datasets to conduct in-depth analysis of customer behavior, market dynamics, and competitive pricing strategies. Extract actionable insights to inform pricing decisions and strategy formulation. Model Evaluation and Optimization: Oversee the evaluation, validation, and optimization of pricing models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and performance. Implement rigorous testing methodologies to assess model effectiveness and robustness. Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including product management, engineering, marketing, and finance to understand business objectives, requirements, and constraints. Work collaboratively to translate business needs into data-driven pricing solutions. Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in pricing analytics, data science, and machine learning. Provide thought leadership and guidance on pricing strategy, methodologies, and implementation best practices. Documentation and Communication: Document methodologies, findings, and recommendations in clear and concise manner. Communicate complex technical concepts and insights to non-technical stakeholders through presentations, reports, and dashboards. Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing: Mentor junior team members and provide guidance on technical and methodological aspects of pricing analytics and data science. Foster a culture of learning and knowledge sharing within the team. What You'll BringPh.D. or equivalent advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field.Extensive experience (8+ years) in data science, machine learning, and statistical analysis, with a focus on pricing optimization.Proven track record of building and deploying pricing algorithms/models in a real-world setting .Expertise in programming languages such as Python, R, or Scala for data analysis and model development.Strong understanding of pricing concepts, methodologies, and strategies in diverse industries.Deep knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques, with hands-on experience in applying them to pricing problems.Excellent communication and leadership skills with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teams.Demonstrated ability to drive projects from conception to completion in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, Hybrid WorkWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.BenefitsBenefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Option 1: Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 5 years' experience in an analytics related field. Option 2: Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 3 years' experience in an analytics related field. Option 3: 7 years' experience in an analytics or related fieldPreferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Data science, machine learning, optimization models, PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Publications or active peer reviewer in related journals or conference, Successful completion of one or more assessments in Python, Spark, Scala, or R, Using open source frameworks (for example, scikit learn, tensorflow, torch), We value candidates with a background in creating inclusive digital experiences, demonstrating knowledge in implementing Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 AA standards, assistive technologies, and integrating digital accessibility seamlessly. The ideal candidate would have knowledge of accessibility best practices and join us as we continue to create accessible products and services following Walmart's accessibility standards and guidelines for supporting an inclusive culture.Primary Location...702 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72716, United States of America

title: Development Engineer
job_description: We move the world – together. As an international leading development partner and supplier of the automotive industry, we at MAHLE are passionate about developing innovative solutions for climate-neutral mobility of tomorrow. Our focus is on e-mobility and thermal management as well as further technology fields to reduce CO2 emissions, such as fuel cells and hydrogen motors.In 2021, MAHLE with its more than 71,000 employees, generated sales of around EUR 11 billion and with its 160 locations, including 12 large research and development centers, is represented in more than 30 countries. Come join our team at MAHLE! #StrongerTogetherSummaryThe Development Engineer analyzes, designs and develops new products and processes and improvements to products and processes by evaluating technical and economic factors, recommending engineering and manufacturing actions for attainment of design objectives of process or product by performing the following duties.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesStrong understanding of safety procedures understanding the impact of potential working hazards.Plans, develops, and maintains process cost standards, cycle times, setup times, routings, and bills of material in the manufacturing system.Fulfills the role of SAP Key User representing engineering activities as they relate to the manufacturing system.Plans, develops, and prepares manufacturing concepts leading to cost quotations for new or modified product designs.Create and or modify 2D and 3D CAD drawings and models (i.e. AutoCAD & Autodesk Inventor Software)Responsible as project leader for new product introductions and assigned APQP projects to ensure that equipment, processes, capacities, and capabilities are implemented to meet customer and company requirements. This may include supplier development activities.Evaluate, analyze, and make recommendations on products, designs, and cost improvements to improve the competitive position of the company.Plans, develops, and oversees test programs for prototypes or samples.Prepares and maintains process documents.Performs technical analysis of competitive products.Provides support to sales and marketing on product presentations and customer support.Direct contact with customer representatives.Working knowledge of QS9000, ISO14001 and IATF16949 standards, as applicable to the position.QualificationsB.S Degree in Engineering from an accredited 4-year College or University.Minimum 5 of experience in engineering and manufacturing environment.Please note this position is not approved for international visa sponsorship.

title: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer
job_description: The Quality Assurance (QA) Automation Engineer will be responsible for leveraging industry standard tools in the development of significant test cases to ensure the functional operation of Murphy USA's mission-critical Point of Sale (POS) systems. This position will work closely with all members of the QA, Development, and Deployment teams and be responsible for ensuring the quality of software products.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. Collaborate with the POS Development Team to understand features and technical implementation.2. Establish quality-centric methodologies and metrics for driving the quality of software development.3. Collaborate with Business partners to develop test plans and test suites that approximate real-world environments.4. Generate robust test strategies to include test plans, automated test cases, and user acceptance tests.5. Utilize automation practices to perform black box, grey box, and white box testing.6. Conduct thorough and ongoing evaluation of testing tools and assist with their design and implementation.7. Perform any other related duties as required or assigned.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCETechnical degree required in such disciplines as Computer Engineering, CPA, etc, plus 5 years related experience and/or training, and 2 years related management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Software Engineer III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...As a Senior, Software Engineer on the Order Intake team, you will use your passion for technology along with your Java and Cloud skillsets to build and maintain applications that make the pharmacy associate's job easier and facilitates the secure and rapid movement of prescriptions in and out of the pharmacy while ensuring we meet or exceed all HIPAA, Legal, and Compliance requirements throughout the process. Additionally, you will be working with technologists that solve some of the most complex problems at Walmart and building solutions that impact millions of patients and associates in the Health & Wellness Pharmacy area.About Team: Health & Wellness Pharmacy - Order IntakeThe Order Intake team within Health & Wellness Pharmacy is responsible for ensuring that each year millions of prescriptions accurately, efficiently, and securely reach Walmart and Sam's Club pharmacies so that millions of patients can save money and live better. We are often the first step in the journey of any prescription being filled at one of our pharmacies and thus strive to build and integrate high quality applications that serve both our pharmacy patients as well as our our pharmacy associates to make their work easier. As proof, we are a team that has been recognized and awarded in the healthcare industry for four consecutive years as a leader in handling and processing electronic prescriptions. That is a standard we aim to uphold.Responsibilities Design, develop, build, and enhance Cloud-based applications using Java and Python. Build dashboards, alerts using Splunk, Dynatrace, Grafana, etc. to monitor applications.Bring a deep curiosity to find and analyze the root cause of any critical business and production issues. Build scripts for automation of repetitive and routine tasks in CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery), Testing or any other process (as applicable)  Implement telemetry features as required independently. Ensure HIPAA security and privacy policy requirements are properly applied to components/application during code development/configuration. Identify short- and long-term goals, reviewing and providing feedback for proposed solutions, performing design and code reviews.  Support and align efforts to meet customer and business needs.  Collaborate with team members to influence the architecture and design of software and help bring quality and optimization into the design of the product.  Take initiative to learn the fundamentals of different coding languages and frameworks that would be useful for future scope of work.  Stay updated on the latest technologies both in the company and industry and be able to utilize them to good effect. What You'll Bring5+ years experience in full stack development of highly scalable applications. Strong computer science fundamentals in algorithms, data structures and databases - including knowledge of SQL and NoSQL .Proficiency in back-end technologies and developing APIs using Java, Spring Boot.  Experience with Cloud Computing platforms: Azure/GCP is a plus.  Knowledge and working experience on CI/CD tools such as GitHub, Maven, Junit, Jenkins, Docker, Sonar and log monitoring tools like Splunk.  Experience in developing robust, high-performance and scalable applications using REST API, API, Spring Boot and knowledge on Microservices development. Understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks like ReactJS or React Native.  Self-directed, well organized, have good follow-up skills & ability to quickly adapt to change.  Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels  Passion for staying current with industry trends and emerging technologies, with a commitment to continuous learning and professional growth. job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...What you'll do...It's exciting time to join our Walmart journey. We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to support the Finance Technology.About The TeamAs a part of Walmart Finance Technology - Finance Data Factory (FDF), we build industry defining Data platform/workflows that process large quality of general ledger data and applications that run on data platform for visualization also, Machine Learning and statistical modeling that enable transparency, governance, and automation. title: Senior Software Engineer
job_description: The Software Engineer is responsible for developing enterprise wide cross-functional software solutions, working closely with TS Software Architect and Business Analyst technical teams. The Software Engineer will serve as an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit and have a passion for moving the organization forward in the technology space. Must have the ability to plan and execute work both independently and as a team member while supporting productions systems that are developed using MSFT development stack including: .NET, C#, C++, ASP .NET, TS-SQL.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. Design, implement, test and maintain software applications within all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).2. Establish, refine and integrate development and test environment tools and software as needed.3. Understand requirements, implement designs, provide administration tools, and documentation for specific projects.4. Participate in Design and Code Reviews.5. Follow and enhance existing development processes.6. Collaborate with other engineers, developers, architects, QA, system engineers and product managers in solving new and existing technical issues.7. Identify production and non-production application issues.8. Identify opportunities to fine-tune and optimize applications.9. Perform any other related duties as required or assigned.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty mentioned satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEBroad knowledge of such fields as accounting, marketing, business administration, finance, etc. Equivalent to a four year college degree, plus 4 years related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: (USA) Distinguished, Software Engineer
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Are you passionate about pioneering cutting-edge technology that can revolutionize the world of associate (employee) experiences? Do you dream of playing a technical role that will shape the future of Global People Systems? If you possess exceptional technical expertise, you may be interested in this opportunity.Join our dynamic and forward-thinking People Technology engineering organization as our Distinguished Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of driving innovation, spearheading transformative projects and foundational improvements. We are seeking a sharp technical leader who can seamlessly bridge the gap between business requests and architecting the technical landscape to deliver. Your projects will have tremendous impact, be scalable, and at the center of modernization efforts in Walmart's People Technology organization.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll DoProvide strategic guidance and hands-on support in the development of best practices, architectural designs, and technology solutions.Lead and mentor teams in the implementation of complex systems, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive the continuous improvement of our technology stack and processes.Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in software engineering, advocating for their adoption where appropriate.Ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and resilient systems that meet business goals and customer needs.Participate in code reviews, architectural discussions, and troubleshooting sessions to ensure the highest standards of development.Drive a culture of accountability, ownership, and inclusivity within the team.Lead the end-to-end integration of Workday and SAP SuccessFactors systems with open source technologies in large-scale tier-0 systems.What You'll Bring Deep Technical Expertise: A distinguished engineer should have extensive knowledge in their field, including advanced concepts in software engineering, system architecture, and technology trends. This expertise is crucial for driving innovation, solving complex technical problems, and providing guidance on best practices. Leadership and Influence: The ability to lead by example, mentor junior engineers, and influence decision-making processes at all levels of the organization is vital. This includes promoting a culture of technical excellence, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering collaboration across teams. Strategic Thinking: A strategic mindset to align technical initiatives with business goals is essential. This involves understanding the broader business context, anticipating future trends and challenges, and making decisions that balance short-term needs with long-term objectives. Excellent Problem-Solving Skills: Distinguished engineers are expected to tackle some of the most challenging problems in the organization. This requires exceptional analytical skills, creativity, and the ability to develop innovative solutions that are scalable, efficient, and effective. Effective Communication and Collaboration: Strong communication skills are necessary to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and effectively negotiate and resolve conflicts. This also includes the ability to listen to and incorporate diverse perspectives and feedback.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, Hybrid WorkWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.BenefitsBeyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. title: GIS/Geotechnical Engineer/Developer
job_description: NiS is in search of a candidate to fulfill our GIS/Geotechnical Engineer/Developer position in Little Rock, Arkansas. The GIS/Geotechnical Engineer/Developer has the opportunity to work on exciting projects while participating in a variety of office and field tasks related to planning, evaluating, designing, and implementing the geotechnical aspects of environmental remedies. The GIS/Geotechnical Engineer/Developer's analytical skills will be called upon as site conditions are evaluated, to determine geotechnical design data needs, assess remedial alternatives, perform engineering calculations, and develop designs. The GIS/Geotechnical Engineer/Developer will use technical writing skills to prepare work plans, reports, and design documents, including design specifications.Job DutiesConduct research, present findings and results, and provide mentorship to fellow geoscientists. Utilize various Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software and tools to collect geospatial data from multiple sources. Perform thorough data analysis to extract valuable insights, trends, and patterns. Create and maintain GIS databases to ensure data accuracy and availability. Conduct Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) surveys to investigate subsurface structures and anomalies. Interpret GPR data to identify potential risks, including utility leaks, concrete defects, or other geologic features. Collaborate with other employees to provide geotechnical insights. Operate drones for aerial data collection, including high-resolution 2D and 3D imagery. Process and analyze drone-collected data to support geospatial and geotechnical projects. Ensure compliance with regulations and safety standards while conducting drone missions. Integrate data from various sources, including GIS databases, GPR surveys, and drone data to create comprehensive geospatial models. Develop automated workflows for seamless data integration and synchronization. Create custom GIS tools and applications to streamline data processing, visualization, and reporting. Maintain and enhance existing GIS applications to meet evolving project needs.Education And Experience Master's degree in Geophysics, Geospatial Science, Geosciences, or closely related field. 5+ years of demonstrated relevant experience in GIS technology, database administration, and systems administration. ArcGIS SDE geodatabase administration within an Esri/Windows Server/SQL Server environment. Experience with Esri technology, Python, SQL, or other scripting/geospatial application development tools.Special Skills/License/CertificationGIS Training in the following specific courses: Python Geocoding Geoprocessing Models Candidate should be willing to obtain a drone license if not already possessed.Other Special Skills Or RequirementsExperience in the following areas: Three (3) years' of intensive experience with GIS. Two (2) years' experience with GPR. Additional required skills include the use of key platforms under the ArcGIS Suite of Tools.NIS OverviewNiS is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Business with an emphasis on Federal government opportunities in support of the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Intelligence Community, and State and local government. NiS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, protected veteran status, race, color, religious creed, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation/gender identity, age, or genetic information.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
job_description: Reliability (ACE) EngineerLocation: El Dorado, ARA leading organization, currently unnamed for confidentiality, is seeking a Reliability Engineer to join our team in El Dorado, Arkansas. This pivotal role bridges the gap between production and maintenance, engineering, and external expertise, ensuring optimal asset care and enhancing operational efficiency. If you're passionate about driving improvement and excel in a collaborative environment, this opportunity is for you.Key Responsibilities:- Implement and uphold Asset Care Excellence (ACE) principles, ensuring all activities adhere to safety operations and compliance.- Develop and maintain equipment maintenance systems and programs that exceed regulatory standards.- Analyze maintenance costs and operational efficiency losses to identify and rectify system inefficiencies.- Lead cross-functional teams in Reliability Centered Maintenance, Root Cause Analysis, Six Sigma, and more, to foster continuous improvement.- Manage the capital project input and budgeting for your area, ensuring alignment with operational goals.- Coordinate and execute maintenance work orders, set scheduling priorities, and drive reductions in emergency work orders.- Lead Root Cause Analysis investigations, ensuring thorough follow-up and implementation of corrective actions.- Oversee mechanical equipment maintenance outside the Mechanical Integrity program, including inventory and documentation management.- Coordinate plant changes to enhance Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), reliability, and process quality.- Develop a reliability strategy that aligns with business needs, focusing on a proactive maintenance approach.Qualifications:- Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering from a 4-year ABET accredited program.- 3-5 years of experience in the Chemical/Process or Petrochemical Industry.- Strong capability to build solid working relationships with production and maintenance teams.- Ability to mentor and teach, coupled with a basic understanding of accounting principles.- This role is safety and security sensitive, requiring handling of hazardous materials and compliance with DHS CFATS regulation.Why Join Us?- Impactful Work: Your efforts directly contribute to the safety and efficiency of our operations, making a tangible difference.- Collaborative Culture: Work in a team-oriented environment where continuous learning and improvement are valued.- Competitive Compensation: Receive a competitive salary and benefits package, reflective of your experience and skills.
Industries: Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing, Agriculture, Construction, Mining Machinery Manufacturing, and Chemical Manufacturing

title: Forecasting Analyst
job_description: Company DescriptionHana Group is a multinational company leading sales in pan-Asian cuisine sold in grocery retailers and commerce marketplaces. The company has tailored brands providing custom collaborations to our partners and to our consumers. Through our distribution company, we are able to deliver on our mission of sustainable sourcing with ingredients that make our food healthy, delicious, and affordable. We aim to CARE about the quality of our service, to ACT to deliver new concepts for finding pan-Asian cuisine, to DARE to deliver sushi and more in new ways to our consumers, and to TRUST in our ability to follow through on customer expectations. We participate in E-Verify and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Job DescriptionThe Forecasting Analyst is a key member of the sales and operations team, responsible for analyzing sales trends, historical data, and client insights to develop accurate sales forecasts and optimize product assortments at the kiosk level. Utilizing Adoria and other analytical tools, the Forecasting Analyst will ensure each kiosk is prepared to meet daily sales demands with an efficient product mix, minimizing waste and maximizing sales. This role involves close collaboration with clients to adjust forecasts for special events and marketing campaigns, and continuous improvement of forecasting models based on actual sales outcomes and feedback.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain advanced forecasting models using sales trends, historical data, and input from clients to predict daily sales at each kiosk. Collaborate with clients to incorporate key events, promotions, and marketing campaigns into sales forecasts. Analyze product performance, waste levels, and customer preferences to recommend adjustments to product assortments, ensuring each kiosk meets its sales potential with minimal waste. Use Adoria software to update and manage product assortments, ensuring accurate and efficient production planning at the kiosk level. Regularly review and adjust forecasts based on actual sales outcomes, seasonal variations, and market trends to continually improve accuracy and efficiency. Work closely with the National Sales Director to develop sales targets and strategies that align with company goals and market opportunities. Prepare and present detailed reports and analyses on sales forecasts, actual sales performance, and assortment optimization efforts to senior management and clients. Serve as the primary point of contact for sales and operations teams for all matters related to sales forecasting and product assortment planning. Stay abreast of industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in forecasting and inventory management to drive continuous improvement. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Statistics, Business, Economics, or related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in sales forecasting, inventory management, or a related analytical role, preferably in a retail or kiosk-based business environment. Proficiency in Power BI and strong Excel skills. Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain accurate forecasting models and to use data analysis for decision making. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and across functional teams. Strong organizational and project management abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Skills:Advanced analytical and quantitative skillsStrong problem-solving and decision-making capabilitiesEffective communication and presentation skillsDetail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and efficiencyProactive and results-driven mindsetAdditional InformationHana Group North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Software Developer implements and improves our IT applications, analyzes system requirements, and addresses any relevant problems. This position also performs standard testing and provides solutions to ensure high levels of performance and security. Ultimately, the Software Developer should be able to translate our internal and external clients’ needs into new high-quality IT systems.It is anticipated that over time the candidate will be able to successfully perform all duties below with effective management and training support.Your Contribution May IncludeExecute full lifecycle software development.Document and maintain software functionality.Identify system requirements.Consult with business partners to track software requirements and features.Collaborate with other developers to produce new systems.Validate changes by testing applications.Train users on new applications and provide support.Ensure system requirements and deadlines are met.Stay up to date with current technologies and technical developments.Formulate and implement solutions to business and system problems.Communicate with customers as appropriate to confirm and understand requirements.Understand what requirements analysis means in the context of a project and how important it is to the outcome.Ensure the testing of applications at various stages throughout the development process.Design application tests to ensure adherence to functional and quality requirements.Understand why business satisfaction is important to successful product/service delivery.Understand the importance of effective business communication.Avoid technical jargon when inappropriate.Focus activities on developing and maintaining positive relationships with the business.Interpret considerations for selecting an optimal testing environment for specific applications.Create test scenarios that ensure all error handling processes perform as expected.Other duties and projects, as assigned.As a Software Developer, you will be a member of the ArcBest Technologies Information Technology team in Fort Smith, AR. Work Schedule: Monday through Friday, expected 40 hours a week with flexibility of hours between 6:00am – 6:00pm. On-call responsibilities required and possible time worked outside of regular work hours depending on workload requirements.Ready to apply? Before doing so, please make sure you meet the minimum requirements:Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant field.Experience: Prior software development experience, preferred.Computer Skills: Strong working knowledge of programming languages such as C# or other .Net languages as well as modern web-based technologies. Familiarity with mainframe technologies is beneficial. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodation@arcb.com . An Equal Opportunity Employer including Vet/Disability."

title: (USA) Staff, Software Engineer
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Are you passionate about pioneering cutting-edge technology that can revolutionize the world of associate (employee) experiences? Do you dream of playing a technical role that will shape the future of Global People Systems? If you possess exceptional technical expertise, you may be interested in this opportunity.Join our dynamic and forward-thinking People Technology engineering organization as our Staff Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of driving innovation, spearheading transformative projects and foundational improvements of Walmart's Workforce Enablement systems. We are seeking a sharp technical leader who will set the tone of engineering-excellence and drive processes and standards within the team. Your projects will have tremendous impact and will be at the center of modernization efforts in Walmart's People Technology organization.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll DoAs a Staff Engineer, you will lead the design of complex software changes and take on the development of exciting new features. In addition, you will partner with your senior and junior teammates throughout the software development lifecycle to cultivate a reciprocal learning environment from development to debugging and operational excellence. Provide technical leadership and use engineering best practices to initiate, plan, and execute large-scale, cross functional, and company-wide projects. Demonstrate craftsmanship and produce high quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration. Investigate and build proof-of-concept prototypes utilizing new technologies and drive their adoption within the mainstream product. Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity, product quality and efficiency. Generate technical documentation and presentations to communicate architectural and design options, and educate development, product, and business teams. Manage and maintain multiple production and non-production environments, ensuring that these environments are setup with the standard automated build and releases processes & deliver with quality, reliability. Build, leverage, and analyze tools, application logs, and analytics data to determine improvements to the product and engineering services. Set high standards for operational excellence and system observability. Participate in code reviews, architectural discussions, and troubleshooting sessions to ensure the highest standards of development. Drive a culture of accountability, ownership, and inclusivity within the team.What You'll Bring 5+ years of experience with software development and architecture 3+ years of experience with developing and operating GraphQL APIs Experience and/or interest in building tooling that makes your engineering colleagues successful Experience and/or interest in architecture, developer tooling, and agile and lean software development 5+ years of experience developing and deploying backend APIs or full stack REACT applications 5+ years of Cloud Native and Container deployments Adept in event driven architecture patterns Experience with TypeScript, REACT, NodeJS and JAVA Passion for Workforce technologies like Workday, SAP SuccessFactors and Full stack applications. Strong communication skills are necessary to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. A strategic mindset to align technical initiatives with business goals is essential.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. title: Data Engineer III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...** Please note : Employment sponsorship is not available for this position **We are looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of engineering experts in Finance Data Factory. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.The Data Engineer will support our Senior Data Engineers, Architects and data analysts on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.About TeamEveryone has data, but the sheer volume of data at Walmart can be limitless. In the Data Engineering team, we help Walmart manage this data by building pipelines and data lakes to prepare big data for analysis and unlocking actionable insights in real-time. We also use cross-departmental data and machine learning to build a holistic view of true profitability, saving millions of dollars across item categories and geographies while assisting our leadership in making better decisions faster.What You'll DoBuild and maintain optimal data platform and pipeline architecture.Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and GCP 'big data' technologies.Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.Create data tools for analytics team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.What You'll BringAdvanced working knowledge with SQL, No-SQL databases.Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.Strong project management and organizational skills.Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.We are looking for a candidate with 3 to 6 Years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. title: Senior Reliability Engineer
job_description: Senior Reliability EngineerOur client, is an market leading producer of industrial and agricultural chemicals in North America, expanding its team and is currently in search of a Senior Reliability Engineer to join their established facility in El Dorado, AR.About Our Client: With a commitment to excellence, our client operates with a vision to become a "best-in-class" diversified chemical and clean energy producer. Grounded in a culture of safety and employee development, they are at the forefront of innovative initiatives aimed at reducing global carbon emissions, including the production of low or no carbon ammonia.Position Overview: As a Senior Reliability Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in providing strategic guidance in asset maintenance, reliability, and outage scope. Acting as a liaison between production, maintenance, and engineering teams, you will lead efforts in maintenance, reliability, and production/capital improvement, while ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and implementing Asset Care Excellence principles. Additionally, you will lead cross-functional teams in reliability improvement initiatives and investigations.Qualifications:Technical expertise coupled with analytical thinkingProcess experience to address process, maintenance, and technical project challengesEngineering Diploma from a recognized institution, preferably in chemical or mechanical engineeringMinimum of 3-5 years of experience within the Chemical/Process or Petrochemical IndustryWhy Join Us: Joining our client's team means being part of a forward-thinking company that leads in its field. You'll have the opportunity to develop solid working relationships with production personnel while teaching and mentoring both production and maintenance teams. In this key position, you'll contribute to the success of the company while advancing your own career in an environment that fosters growth, innovation, and professional development.How to Apply: If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a meaningful impact in the chemical industry, don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of something exceptional. Click apply now or email your updated resume to Matt.drelincourt@infinitekgroup.com.

title: Data Engineer III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...At Walmart, we help people save money, so they can live better. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision we make and drives us to create the future of retail. We can't do that without the best talent - talent that is innovative, curious, and driven to create exceptional experiences for our customers.Do you have boundless energy and passion for engineering data used to solve dynamic problems that will shape the future of retail? With the sheer scale of Walmart's environment comes the biggest of big data sets.As a Walmart Data Engineer in Marketplace, you will dig into our mammoth scale of data to help unleash the power of retail data science by imagining, developing, and maintaining data pipelines that our Data Scientists and Analysts can rely on.You will be responsible for contributing to an orchestration layer of complex data transformations, refining raw data from source into targeted, valuable data assets for consumption in a governed way. You will partner with Data Scientists, Analysts, other engineers and business stakeholders to solve complex and exciting challenges so that we can build out capabilities that evolve the retail business model while making a positive impact on our customers' and sellers' lives.About The Data And Customer Analytics (DCA) OrganizationOur organization focuses on managing and delivering world-class data assets, including creating and maintaining data standards, driving policy compliance, creating partnerships, and developing pipelines and self-service tools. We empower our business to leverage data to fuel growth, driving revenue in our core and building new business model opportunities.What You'll DoYou will use cutting edge data engineering techniques to create critical datasets and dig into our mammoth scale of data to help unleash the power of data science by imagining, developing, and maintaining data pipelines that our Data Scientists and Analysts can rely on.You will be responsible for contributing to an orchestration layer of complex data transformations, refining raw data from source into targeted, valuable data assets for consumption in a governed way.You will partner with Data Scientists, Analysts, other engineers, and business stakeholders to solve complex and exciting challenges so that we can build out capabilities that evolve the marketplace business model while making a positive impact on our customers' and sellers' lives.You will participate with limited help in small to large sized projects by reviewing project requirements; gather requested information; write and develop code; conduct unit testing; communicate status and issues to team members and stakeholders; collaborate with project team and cross functional teams; troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes; and ensure on-time delivery and hand-offs.You will design, develop and maintain highly scalable and fault-tolerant real time, near real time and batch data systems/pipelines that process, store, and serve large volumes of data with optimal performance.You will ensure data ingested and processed is accurate and of high quality by implementing data quality checks, data validation, and data cleaning processes.You will identify possible options to address business problems within one's discipline through analytics, big data analytics, and automation.You will build business domain knowledge to support the data need for product teams, analytics, data scientists and other data consumers.What You'll BringAt least 2+ years of experience development of big data technologies/data pipelines Experience in managing and manipulating huge datasets in the order of terabytes (TB) is essential.Experience with in big data technologies like Hadoop, Apache Spark (Scala preferred), Apache Hive, or similar frameworks on the cloud (GCP preferred, AWS, Azure etc.) to build batch data pipelines with strong focus on optimization, SLA adherence and fault tolerance.Experience in building idempotent workflows using orchestrators like Automic, Airflow, Luigi etc.Experience in writing SQL to analyze, optimize, profile data preferably in BigQuery or SPARK SQL Strong data modeling skills are necessary for designing a schema that can accommodate the evolution of data sources and facilitate seamless data joins across various datasets.Ability to work directly with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate that to pipeline development / data solution work.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are crucial for identifying and resolving issues that may arise during the data integration and schema evolution process.Ability to move at a rapid pace with quality and start delivering with minimal ramp up time will be crucial to succeed in this initiative.Effective communication and collaboration skills are necessary for working in a team environment and coordinating efforts between different stakeholders involved in the project.Nice To Have From You Experience building complex near real time (NRT) streaming data pipelines using Apache Kafka, Spark streaming, Kafka Connect with a strong focus on stability, scalability and SLA adherence. Good understanding of REST APIs - working knowledge on Apache Druid, Redis, Elastic search, GraphQL or similar technologies. Understanding of API contracts, building telemetry, stress testing etc. Exposure in developing reports/dashboards using Looker/Tableau Experience in eCommerce domain preferred.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to join our Global People Technology & Services organization. This role requires an individual who is a subject matter expert in observability, continuous integration (CI), continuous delivery (CD), systems architecture, and software engineering. You will be instrumental in guiding our technology strategy and driving operational excellence across the organization.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll DoServe as a subject matter expert in observability, CI/CD, systems architecture, and software engineering.Provide strategic guidance and hands-on support in the development of best practices, architectural designs, and technology solutions.Lead and mentor teams in the implementation of complex systems, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive the continuous improvement of our technology stack and processes.Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in software engineering, advocating for their adoption where appropriate.Ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and resilient systems that meet business goals and customer needs.Participate in code reviews, architectural discussions, and troubleshooting sessions to ensure the highest standards of development.Drive a culture of accountability, ownership, and inclusivity within the team.What You'll BringDeep Technical Expertise: A distinguished engineer should have extensive knowledge in their field, including advanced concepts in software engineering, system architecture, and technology trends. This expertise is crucial for driving innovation, solving complex technical problems, and providing guidance on best practices.Leadership and Influence: The ability to lead by example, mentor junior engineers, and influence decision-making processes at all levels of the organization is vital. This includes promoting a culture of technical excellence, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering collaboration across teams.Strategic Thinking: A strategic mindset to align technical initiatives with business goals is essential. This involves understanding the broader business context, anticipating future trends and challenges, and making decisions that balance short-term needs with long-term objectives.Excellent Problem-Solving Skills: Distinguished engineers are expected to tackle some of the most challenging problems in the organization. This requires exceptional analytical skills, creativity, and the ability to develop innovative solutions that are scalable, efficient, and effective.Effective Communication and Collaboration: Strong communication skills are necessary to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and effectively negotiate and resolve conflicts. This also includes the ability to listen to and incorporate diverse perspectives and feedback.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, Hybrid WorkWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.BenefitsBeyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and5 years' experience in software engineering or related area.Option 2: 7 years' experience in software engineering or related area.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 3 years' experience in software engineering or related area.Primary Location...508 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712, United States of America

title: Appian Developer
job_description: Do you wish to redefine yourself in this post-digital age by stretching your own professional skill and capability boundary?The Accenture Digital Process Automation practice has multiple openings for experienced Appian practitioners to inject fresh thoughts and ideas into our continuous innovation engine and expand your own professional service footprints on the client market platform across all major industry verticals in North America and globally.As a practice, our mission and specialty are to leverage leading Digital Process Automation technologies (e.g. Appian) as the catalyst to partner with our clients to reimagine the future of business. We have the distinctive advantage to tap into the unprecedented scale of disruptive technology capabilities as well as the cross-industry strategy thought leadership within Accenture, virtually unlimited training resources and opportunities, a vast global network of DPA professionals sharing similar drive and passion, and the “partner of choice” level of alliance with leading technology vendors.We will assist you in finding the right level to launch your Accenture Technology consulting career, and carving out an accelerated career development path to take increasing scope of responsibilities across the full spectrum of DPA consulting value chain: business and IT strategy, digital transformation solutioning, delivery management, enterprise architecture, functional design and implementation, CX/UX, mobility, integrated platforms (RPA/ML/IoT/Block Chain/Analytics) and DevOps. There are also opportunities for growing Appian Community of Practice, DPA Center of Excellence, sales, client relationship and vendor alliance development. The Work (Role Description) Depending on the hiring level, the role ranges from Appian Delivery Lead, Functional and Technical Architect, to Senior Developer and Designer. The Delivery Lead is accountable for the overall project success and client relationship, partnering with Lead Architect(s) to jointly shape up the functional and technical design of the solution, manage work decomposition and distribution, manage scope and task prioritization, to ensure quality delivery on time and under budget.The Functional/Technical Architects owns the design and quality inspection of various deliverables. They also help facilitate project discovery, requirement gathering, demo, testing, training and deployment processes. The Senior Developer/Designers contribute to solution design, implementation, deployment and support various testing activities of the project.In your role as an Appian DPA Architect in Accenture, your day may look like this:8:30am ………………….…. Daily sync up with distributed Accenture team (teammates can be anywhere from US/Canada/India/Philippines/Mexico/Brazil/Argentina/etc.)9:00am ……………….….….Daily standup call with full project team including client teams9:30am : 11am …….….Multiple breakout work sessions on targeted issue/topicsLunch ………………..….…. A quick bite while watching annually updated Accenture Tech Vision video playbacks1:00pm : 3:00pm ….. Roll up the sleeves to work on your deliverables3:00pm : 3:30pm ….. Do something mind refreshing3:30pm : 4:00pm ….. Meet with client enterprise architect on integration topics4:00pm : 4:30pm ….. Meet with client business leads to socialize design ideas4:30pm : 5:00pm ….. Project team (local time zones) sync up and compile status/work transition email to distributed team members.5:00pm : 5:30pm ….. Review discussion threads on Accenture’s Global Appian Community of Practice portal, or continue writing up your article about a design pattern best practice for Accenture Knowledge Exchange publicationTravel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.Here's What You Need (Basic Qualifications)Appian CertificationMinimum of 2 years of experience of Appian design, development, system integrations, deployment of enterprise system solutions.Minimum of 3 years of software technology industry experience.Minimum of 2 years in the field of Business Process Management (BPM)Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)Bonus points if you have:Appian Lead Developer Certification (or commensurate level of Appian experience)Appian experience in either Databases (MariaDB, Oracle etc) or UI DevelopmentExperience of business process and data modeling using mainstream tools (Visio, Metastorm/Opentext, Aris, ERWin, etc.)Experience and knowledge of other low code BPM/DPA technologies (Pega, Mendix, Outsystems, Communda etc.)Experience and skills in technology fit/gap analysis, vendor assessment, use case assessment, solution roadmapping and executive presentationExperience in Agile Scrum project management and/or execution Experience in Appian software installation on various type of on-prem/cloud infrastructuresCompensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.Information on benefits is here.Role Location Annual Salary RangeCalifornia $73,000 to $168,600Colorado $73,000 to $145,700New York $67,600 to $168,600Washington $77,700 to $155,100andWhat We BelieveWe have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization.
