title: Data Analyst
job_description: Darragh is seeking a Data Analyst to join our team at our location in Little Rock, AR. If you have strong and proficient data analysis skills, strong problem solving skills, IT related work experience, then check out this opportunity. Join a legacy of excellence! For over a century, Darragh has been the trusted source for top-notch building materials and expert guidance across the south. Our commitment to delivering exceptional customer service and products has made us the continue choice for professionals in the industry.The Data Analyst will collaborate with clients, end users, and other stakeholders to assess usability needs, requirements, and specifications for the requested program or data application. Continue to develop all data applications and data warehouses to provide relevant and accurate information.Core ResponsibilitiesUtilize Power Bi to analyze complex data sets, craft insightful visualizations, and provide stakeholders with valuable data to drive decision making.Analyzes existing program logic to troubleshoot malfunctions and modifies logic to eliminate issues and increase operational efficiency.Designs and programs applications and software to meet identified needs.Performs diagnostic testing on programs, which may include reading code or running diagnostic software to detect syntax or logic errors.Prepares proposals that include flowcharts and diagrams to illustrate steps and logical operations to be used for training users.Benefits And CultureDarragh is a fourth-generation, family owned and operated company with an emphasis on career development and a family atmosphere. Company will provide laptop and other required equipment. Generous benefits package that includes health insurance with a portion company paid, dental, vision, company paid long-term disability insurance, and other benefits too numerous to list. We also offer a 401K with a high matching program.Core Required SkillsMinimum two to three years related work experience; or combination of experience, training, education, or certification.SQL server database knowledge including stored procedures.Proficient in Power Bi, specifically with visualization and representations; Linux or .NET to develop or manipulate ETL pipelines for data warehousing.Highly proficient with or ability to learn coding languages used in organization.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to derive insights from complex datasetsStrong Initiative to work on own as well as in a team environment; attention to detail.If you are looking to join a company who values work and family balance, Darragh is for you. You receive flexible paid time off upon hire with a company that invests in their employees. We offer training and professional development opportunities for all of our employees. If you are looking for a career and not just a job, visit www.darraghcompany.com/careers .

title: Senior Software Engineer
job_description: What you'll do...We are seeking an experienced SAP HCM Payroll Functional expert to join our Payroll Tech team. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 2-3 end-to-end SAP Payroll implementations including at least one large scale end-to-end SAP Payroll implementation. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the largest-ever payroll implementation. About Team: The Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech’s Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What you'll do:Your responsibilities will include translating requirements into technical solutions, gathering necessary information, such as design documents and product requirements, and SAP payroll config.You will also conduct unit testing, communicate status and issues to team members and stakeholders, collaborate with project and cross-functional teams, troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes, ensure on-time delivery and hand-offs, and provide leadership to the project team.Your role will involve SAP Payroll configuration, reviews, troubleshooting data and config issues by gathering information, issue resolution, conducting root cause analysis, unit testing and completing necessary documentation.Develop high-quality, scalable, performance-effective and customer-centric solutions in SAP payroll for the US and Canada.Perform hands-on configuration (customizing) work to support new and existing functionality.Serve as the resident team expert for SAP Payroll configuration issues in both support and new implementations.Design and review configuration and functional specifications, collaborating with ABAP HR developers to develop and test significant new functionality and enhancements.Create and execute unit test scenarios for quality assurance activities to ensure all requirements are met.Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for leveraging standard SAP product capabilities.Assist in the technical preparation of Test Scenarios, and End-user documentation.Additionally, you will provide support to the payroll business, developers & test automation engineers by addressing inquiries, concerns, and issues. This includes assessing technical feasibility, developing implementation strategies, identifying short and long-term solutions, facilitating resolutions, and leading cross-functional partnerships.Furthermore, you will take the lead in the discovery phase of medium to large projects. This includes collaborating with the SAP product team, project management, payroll business, and automation teams to develop high-level designs and obtain cross-functional approvals.Collaborate with business users and process owners to identify requirements, design enhancements, and functionality to meet payroll business needs.Facilitate problem-solving discussions with the business, internal teams, and project managers to resolve issues and maintain project continuity and requirements.In summary, you will demonstrate expertise in developing and executing action plans, test automaton, support the implementation of business solutions, model compliance with company policies and procedures, and ensure successful delivery of Payroll with a focus on architectural qualities. Your role will involve extensive collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, coaching on appropriate solutions, and driving efficient technical solution design.What you'll bring:A minimum of 8 years relevant experience.At least 2-3 end-to-end SAP Payroll implementations including at least one large scale end-to-end SAP Payroll.Hands-on experience in the following areas: - Payroll Control Center (PCC) configuration - HRSP upgrades and year-end activities - BSI tax factory configuration and maintenance - Wage type setup - SCHEMA, PCRs & Taxes for US & CA - Garnishments configuration - Finance posting - Payment models - Taxability setup - Remuneration statement.Experience in year-end activities.Experience in both Agile and Waterfall project methodologies and tasks required during each phase of implementation.Experience in working in a blended delivery model for greenfield and brownfield implementations and operations support.Experience with mid-year/mid-quarter payroll go-live.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, hybrid work:We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.Benefits:Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more. Equal Opportunity Employer:Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process. Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 3 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Option 2: 5 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering, or related area and 1 year's experience in software engineering or related area.Primary Location...608 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712-6207, United States of America
Industries: Retail, Technology, Information and Media, and Software Development

BitBucket, JIRA, Confluence etc.Continuous Integration tools such as Bamboo, Jenkins, or TFSLocation: This position will be based in Bentonville, AR

title: Service Delivery Engineer
job_description: Who we are:BigID is an innovative tech startup that focuses on solutions for data security, compliance, privacy, and governance. We're leading the market in all things data: helping our customers reduce risk, drive business innovation, achieve compliance, build customer trust, make better decisions, and get more value from their data.We are building a global team with a passion for innovation and next-gen technology. BigID has been recognized for being one of CNBC’s Top 25 Startups powering the economy, we're on Built In's 2023 Best Places to Work, one of America's fastest-growing companies, Inc5000 2023, 3 years running, one of the 20 coolest identity access management and data protection companies, CRN Security 100 2023, a Market Leader in DSPM at the 11th annual Global InfoSec Awards (Cyber Defense Magazine) and 2023 Disruptor Gold Winner - Most Disruptive Cyber Security Software, Globee Awards.At BigID, our team is the foundation of our success. Join a people-centric culture that is fast-paced and rewarding: you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in the industry who value innovation, diversity, integrity, and collaboration.Who we seek:BigID is growing, and we are expanding our Services Team and seeking a Service Delivery Engineer. The services team plays an important role in the successful setup, integration, and deployment of BigID's discovery tools, for our customers and implementation partners. This position also works to identify the root cause of any deployment issues and works with the larger team to help resolve them to ensure the success of the customer.What you’ll do:Work closely with client stakeholders to determine technical requirements for specific business objectives at handPlan implementation engagements, deploy solution components, and participate in the product configuration efforts to meet clients’ specific requirementsEngage with multi-discipline internal and client teams to ensure smooth rollout of BigID solutions and successful integration within customers’ environmentsDeliver training for respective technologies at an applicable level of depth and detail for a given audienceWork closely with our Engineering and Product Management teams to document product issues, enhancement requests raised in the field, and possible implementation flow improvementsWhat you’ll bring:Experience in information technology, with at least 1-2 years in a customer-facing role – preferably involved in product implementation and hands-on technical activities within enterprise corporate environmentsUnderstand operational parameters and troubleshooting for a combination of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications DevelopmentAdvanced experience in problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training and solution deploymentA proactive approach in understanding internal and customers business challengesProfessional experience in Docker and Kubernetes deployments. Meaningful experience with some DBs, such as MongoDB, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, IBM DB2Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud PlatformExperience with Hadoop (HIVE/Spark)Experience with REST APIProgramming or scripting skills with Bash or PythonOur Values:We look for people who embody our values - Care, Do, Try & Shine.Care - We care about our customers and each otherDo - We do what it takes to make a positive impactTry - We try our best and we don’t give upShine - We shine and make it our mission to always stand outThe annual base salary range is $100,000 - $120,000. Actual salaries will vary and are based on a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. Salary is just one component of our Compensation Philosophy. Variable/Bonus Compensation & Equity Incentives align with individual and company performance.BigBenefits: 💻 Work from home with a global remote-first communityGlobal Culture CornerFlexible PTO and Quarterly Volunteer Days💸 Equity Participation100% employer-covered medical, dental, and vision options available to you🐶 Additional insurance benefits like pet insurance and legal assistance📚 Learning & Development OpportunitiesFidelity Employer Sponsored 401KRobust DEI Program with several vibrant ERG communitiesPaid Parental LeaveBigDiversity: We’re committed to creating a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality – across race, gender, sexuality, disability, and neurodiversity – where innovation and growth thrive, every voice is heard, and everybody belongs. Learn more about us here.CPRA Employee Privacy Notice: CA BigID is an E-Verify Participant.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
job_description: At Avanade, we see how the power of Dynamics 365 shapes the future of businesses every day. By combining our unmatched Microsoft knowledge with our creative approach to innovation and strong industry knowledge, we create a lot of opportunities for Microsoft, our clients, and for you. Avanade has countless paths for you to pursue. One of them is sure to lead to your unique version of success. Come join us As a D365 Customer Engagement (CE) Developer, you’ll be considered a learned professional that applies your subject matter expertise to design and implement CRM solutions for our clients across all phases of Avanade’s projects. You’ll solve problems using CRM solutions as you liaise between Avanade clients and project teams made up of Project Managers, Back-End and Front-End (UX) Architects, and other CE professionals. This role provides the opportunity to work for Microsoft’s #1 partner with an unrivaled focus on personal development and training in both technology and softer consulting skills. Together we do what matters. What you'll do * Consult and advise our clients and internal stakeholders on uses of technology to solve business problems * Perform application development, complex code development, application testing, and component design * Write technical specifications and collaborate with the functional team to ensure requirements are understood * Prototype, configure, and test respective business processes * Enable the design of conceptual architecture and technical solutions * Use key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and test the quality of projects * Improve your clients’ business by identifying potential challenges and supporting continuous improvement through their CRM system Skills and experiencesss * At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE or Dynamics CRM * Experience analyzing, designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining Microsoft Dynamics CRM and Power Platform application code for Sales and Customer Service functionality * Used Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) environments, Microsoft SQL Server, HTML, Microsoft ASP, and Microsoft .NET * Client management skills and the ability to work with customers to develop and manage an action plan * Due to client requirements, candidates for this role must be United States Citizens or have a Green Card and have lived in the United States for at least three years on an ongoing basis * Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner and/or end user About you Characteristics that can spell success for this role * Analytical, curious, agile * Team player and good communicator * Problem-solver, patient, quality-driven * Passionate about new technologies * Innovative mindset Enjoy your career Some of the best things about working at Avanade * Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications) * Real-time access to technical and skilled resources * Collaborate with some of the brightest "Microsoft minds" * Build your expertise, solve problems, learn, and develop Find out more about some of our benefits [1] here. A great place to work As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our [2] Inclusion & Diversity page. Create a future for our people that focuses on • Expanding your thinking • Experimenting courageously • Learning and pivoting Inspire greatness in our people by • Empowering every voice • Encouraging boldness • Celebrating progress Accelerate the impact of our people by • Amazing the client • Prioritizing what matters • Acting as one Learn more To Learn more about the types of projects our team works on, check out these case studies: [3] What matters to Northern Tool + Equipment [4] Breville expands culinary experiences by entering new markets 80% faster Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs: [5] Avanade Insights - exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation [6] Inside Avanade - explore what life is like working at Avanade References Visible links 1. https://www.avanade.com/en-us/career/benefits 2. https://www.avanade.com/en-us/about-avanade/inclusion-and-diversity 3. https://www.avanade.com/en/clients/nte 4. https://www.avanade.com/en/clients/breville 5. https://www.avanade.com/en/blogs/avanade-insights 6. https://www.avanade.com/en/blogs/inside-avanade

title: Business Intelligence Developer
job_description: OverviewWorking at Arkansas Federal Credit UnionGeneral Description Of PositionThe Business Intelligence Developer serves as a lead developer in support of IT and strategic initiatives throughout the organization. This position works closely with leadership and other team members to deliver innovative solutions through ad hoc queries, reports, forms, extracts, dashboards, and other data solutions with a high level of accuracy. Responsible for providing assistance to less experienced developers. Remote work eligible.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Demonstrate enthusiastic support of the corporate mission, core values and long-term objectives. Performs job duties within our bylaws, regulations, Board of Directors' policies, established internal and external service standards and our work procedures. Results oriented with strong problem solving and analytical abilities along with a strong attention to details and focus on quality. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and tight deadlines.Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to multi-task, reprioritize, and escalate as necessary.Lead the ongoing development and operations of enterprise data warehouse. Develop, implement, and maintain new data sources in the data warehouse. Intermediate experience in Microsoft SQL, Oracle, and ETL tools.Manage architecture, administration, maintenance and support of the BI platform. Evaluate and implement system upgrades ensuring proper communication of end user awareness and best practices. Experience with SAP Business Objects Business Intelligence Suite (Crystal Reports, Webi or Lumira) desired.Design, develop, validate and maintain organized data analytics, reports, report definitions, data extracts, forms, dashboards, etc. Write complex queries, views and stored procedures. Experience performing ETL desired.Strong project management skills including the ability to lead or to participate as a subject matter expert in projects, the ability to understand business processes and identify risks, the ability to provide creative solutions, the ability to monitor the project status and provide updates to project stakeholders.Collaborate with departments to understand business workflow and processes. Recommend and implement data related solution in response to a business problem.Provide guidance, training and technical support to departments relating to reports, forms and data analytics.Assist team members with less experience.Perform any other related duties as required or assigned.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty mentioned satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.Education And ExperienceBroad knowledge of such fields as accounting, marketing, business administration, finance, etc. Equivalent to a four year college degree, plus 3 to 7 years related experience and/or training, and 3 to 7 years related management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. EEO Statement Arkansas Federal Credit Union is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Systems and Infrastructure Engineer III,
job_description: As a System Engineer III on the Alerting, Logging, and Monitoring team, you will be driving security value by implementing and refining the alerting, logging, and monitoring toolsets. Pushing the status quo by continuing to revise our strategic approach that enables delivery through collaboration within Information Security.About Team: At Walmart, we prioritize innovation and data security. Our team is dedicated to maintaining a secure operating environment and preserving the trust of our customers, associates, and stakeholders. We combine a range of services and expertise to prevent fraud, detect threats, and manage digital risk and access. Our focus is on mitigating attack risks, securing cloud transformation, and fostering a culture of security and reliability within our teamWhat you'll do:Evaluate problems and develop solutions with the monitoring team.Work with Information Security teams to understand alerting and monitoring needs.Ability to independently develop new capabilities on new and existing applications.Be able to provide documentation and train team members.What you'll bring:Experience with alerting and service monitoring.Experience developing strategy for a team or product.Experience with Security Service offerings.Experience with logging onboarding.Familiarity with HIPAA, PCI DSS, SOX, and other industry or regulatory compliance.Ability to strive in a fast-paced environment.Excellent time management and organizational skills, capable of meeting goals and driving towards results.Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to varying audiences.Development skills such as React, JavaScript, Java, .Net, SQL, Mongo, NoSQLScripting experience with Python and PowerShell.About Walmart Global Tech:Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity experts and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, hybrid work:We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.Benefits:Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity Employer:Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensiveWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. title: Senior Data Analyst
job_description: Come and join a company committed to leveraging data-driven insights to optimize decision-making and drive business growth. As a Senior Data Analyst specializing in PowerBI and Azure, you will play a critical role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement data visualization solutions using PowerBI and leverage Azure services for data storage, processing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of data visualization best practices.You willDevelop interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using Power BI to communicate key metrics and insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, understand business objectives, and translate them into data visualization solutions.Design and implement data models in PowerBI that enable users to analyze large datasets efficiently.Utilize Azure services such as Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Analysis Services for data ingestion, storage, and analysis.Perform data cleansing, transformation, and aggregation to ensure data accuracy and reliability.Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support business decision-making and identify opportunities for process improvement.Provide mentorship and guidance to junior analysts and team members on data visualization best practices and techniques.Stay current with industry trends and advancements in Power BI and Azure technologies to continuously enhance the company's data analytics capabilities.Who you areBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.Minimum of 5 years of experience as a data analyst, with a focus on data visualization and analytics.Proficiency in Power BI with a strong portfolio demonstrating your ability to design and develop effective dashboards and reports.Hands-on experience with Azure services such as Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, Azure Analysis Services, and Azure Data Factory.Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling techniques, and SQL querying.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.Proven track record of delivering high-quality work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities.
Industries: Services for Renewable Energy, Air, Water, and Waste Program Management, and Software Development

title: Staff, Software Engineer - Master Data Governance Finance (Bentonville, AR)
job_description: What you'll do...Do you love building and pioneering in the technology space? Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive and iterative delivery environment? At Walmart, you’ll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs.We are seeking a Staff, Software Engineer – SAP Master Data Functional, who is passionate about implementing and managing Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) technologies to join our team. As a Walmart Software Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of driving major financial transformations at Walmart scale.About Team: EBS FintechOur team is focused on developing a streamlined, dependable company that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and Associate Digital Experience (ADE). We also provide a variety of services such as procurement, supplier portfolio management, merchandising master data, and analytics. From developing HR chatbots and virtual assistants to creating invoice solutions and facilitating legal changes, we help drive efficiency across Walmart globally. Our team works closely with our US stores and eCommerce business to better serve customers by empowering team members, stores, and merchants with technological innovation. From groceries and entertainment to sporting goods and crafts, Walmart U.S. offers an extensive selection that our customers value, whether they shop online at Walmart.com, through one of our mobile apps, or in-store. Focus areas include customers, stores and employees, in-store service, merchant tools, merchant data science, and search and personalization.What You’ll Do:Drive design, development, implementation, documentation and follow agile development process. Build, test and deploy cutting edge solutions at scale, impacting associates of Walmart worldwide. Interact with Walmart engineering teams across geographies to leverage expertise and contribute to the tech community. Be involved in the successful implementation by applying technical skills, to design and build enhanced processes and technical solutions in support of strategic initiatives. Work closely with the Tech Leads/Architects and cross functional teams and follow established practices for the delivery of solutions meeting QCD (Quality, Cost & Delivery) within the established architectural guidelines. Follow TDD to ensure testing and code coverage. Learn new and changing technologies and adapt to ensure best software practices and standards. Participate in hiring and support to build teams Interact closely for requirements with Business owners and technical teams both within India and across the globe. What you'll bring:You’ll really wow us if…Bachelor/master's degree in IT, computer sciences or business with additional qualifications in technology.11 to 15 years of project solutions delivery (design/configuration) experience in SAP Master Data Governance (SAP MDG, S/4 HANA) solutions integrated with SAP ERP/S4, with at least one global organization.Experience in rollout / implementing SAP S4 HANA master data solutions. In depth understanding of Master Data Governance, Master Data Elements like Business Partners, Legal Entities, Hierarchies and integration with accounting systems.Strong knowledge of Consolidation and Workflow management.Hands-on experience in handling large size SAP implementations for Fortune 100 clientsDeep expertise to customize and configure SAP tools in addition to SAP standard functionalities.Experience with SAP support and green field implementations.Good understanding of integrations across enterprise landscapes: e.g. SAP, MDG.Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams, to work collaboratively with employees within department and across functions.Should have worked in large scale implementations, transformation projects and played a critical role in gathering and defining requirements, FIT GAP analysis, system configurations, project planning and deliveries etc.Ability to communicate complex concepts/customer problems in a simple way to internal & external stakeholders.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, hybrid work:We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.Benefits:Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity Employer:Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process. Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 4 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Option 2: 6 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering, or related area and 2 years' experience in software engineering or related area Primary Location...2501 Se J St, Ste A, Bentonville, AR 72716-3724, United States of America
Industries: Retail, Financial Services, and Software Development

title: Senior, Software Engineer- SAP Payroll ABAP-HR Expert
job_description: What you'll do...We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer with expertise in ABAP HR in SAP HCM Payroll domain to join our team. The ideal candidate should have 8+ years of relevant experience, 2-3 SAP Payroll implementations including at least one large scale end-to-end SAP Payroll implementation. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the largest-ever payroll implementation for 2 million associates.About Team: The Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech’s Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What you'll do:Execute SAP HCM Payroll Development tasks to enhance or add functionality to the existing/new SAP PA & Payroll landscape, with a specific emphasis on the HCM & Payroll modules.Responsible for designing, developing, reviewing, debugging, and unit testing SAP HR ABAP, Portal, and Fiori applications.The role will involve SAP RICEF objects development, reviews, troubleshooting code issues by gathering information, issue resolution, conducting root cause analysis, unit testing and completing necessary documentation.The responsibilities will include translating requirements into technical solutions, gathering necessary information, such as design documents and product requirements, and code development. You will also conduct technical unit testing, communicate status and issues to team members and stakeholders, collaborate with project and cross-functional teams, troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes, ensure on-time delivery and hand-offs.Additionally, you will provide support to the payroll business & SAP payroll functional engineers by addressing inquiries, concerns, and issues. This includes assessing technical feasibility, identifying short and long-term solutions, performance optimization, facilitating resolutions, and leading cross-functional partnerships.Mentoring Junior members of the team. Extensive collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, coaching on appropriate solutions, and driving efficient technical solution design & build.In summary, you will demonstrate expertise in developing and executing action plans, expertise in SAP Payroll, support the implementation of business solutions, model compliance with company policies and procedures, and ensure successful delivery and support of the SAP Payroll with a focus on best coding practices.What you'll bring:Comprehensive understanding of Payroll business processes, Functional and technical specifications.Experience in designing ABAP RICEF objects, particularly using ABAP Proxies for integrations.Strong knowledge of debugging and troubleshooting object-oriented ABAP HR issues.Excellent communication and coordination skills with onshore-offshore teams and business stakeholders.Hands-on experience in Alerts Mechanism, Change Management, and Transport Management process (Environment SOLMAN).Ability to handle multiple deliverables and projects simultaneously.Experience working closely with Business process teams.different systems such as Workday, SAP Finance, Time & Attendance, ServiceNow, Benefits, and Garnishments.Proficient in Object-Oriented Programming, Dialog Programming, Modular Programming, Dynamic Programming, RFC (Remote Function Calls), and BAPI (Business Application Programming Interface), BAdIs (Business Add-Ins) & Parallel Processing.Direct experience in designing and working extensively with interface between SAP HCM and Analyze support issues in collaboration with functional team members and business analysts.Highly motivated, flexible, open to learning new things, and customer-focused, with the ability to meet tight deadlines.Thorough understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures, and standards.Ability to monitor and manage task progress.Ability to work with limited supervision and a strong sense of urgency.Functional knowledge of SAP Personnel Administration, Payroll (US/CA), Time Management, Garnishments, Benefits, and respective info types.General understanding of the accounting process, such as GL posting from Payroll.Familiarity with SAP Payroll Control Center (PCC) and ticketing tools like Service Now.Experience in infotype decoupled framework.Proficient in Unit and Performance testing, quality analysis, and integration testing.Familiarity with the SAP upgrade process (SPAU/SPDD) including system preparation data migration and post-upgrade activities is crucial. Proficiency in Support Pack upgrade, handling SPDD & SPAU, OSS Note activities. Experience in handling Dual maintenance Set-up.Ability to create, manage, communicate, and meet project timelines and goals.SAP implementation project experience and aware of SDLC, Waterfall and Agile methodologies.Experience or exposure to the following is a plus.Mid-year/mid-quarter payroll go-live.Epi-Use toolsAbout Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, hybrid work:We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.Benefits:Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity Employer:Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.Minimum Qualifications...Option 1: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, computer information systems, software engineering, or related area and 3 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Option 2: 5 years’ experience in software engineering or related area.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering, or related area and 1 year's experience in software engineering or related area.Primary Location...608 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712-6207, United States of America
Industries: Retail and Technology, Information and Media

title: Sr ABAP Developer
job_description: Senior SAP ABAP developer for modernizing SAP ECC applications to ensure security, compliance, accessibility, and compatibility with current technology.This position will be required to be on-site for the first few weeks for system, team, and stakeholder orientation. Then a hybrid/remote work environment will be established based upon mutual agreement. There will always be occasions where the chosen candidate will need to be on-site for special meetings.DFA has a variety of custom, manual applications written in Microsoft Access Database. The creator of these DB's is retiring so DFA is modernizing these items by transitioning them to AASIS applications using SAP Technology. In addition, DFA has a multitude of system changes required either by legislation or Department requirements. DFA needs additional ABAP assistance to deal with the volume of these requirements.DFA needs a senior SAP ABAP developer for modernizing SAP ECC applications to ensure security, compliance, accessibility, and compatibility with current technology. Due to the age of these applications, business processes have been reviewed and opportunities for efficiencies have been identified. The defined applications should be re-written within SAP to include the needed enhancements. The work done on these work efforts will be used as a model for all future development along with knowledge transfer to state employees.Roles And ResponsibilitiesRequired: 8+ Years' experience in SAP ABAP WRICEF development programming skills in SAP ECC or HANA environmentMandatory experience of SAP HANA ABAP knowledge/understanding for Functional areas like SAP FI (AP, AR, AA, GL), CO, Procurement (MM), SAP HR/HCM/SuccessFactors and Budget.Expertise in report programming using ALV, classical, drill down and interactive using ALV events, User exists, Business Transaction Events (BTE), Business Add Ins (BADI), Enhancement Spots (Implicit & Explicit), Module pool programming using custom controls (ALV/Tree/Image), developing data migration programs, LSMW scripts (BDC, BAPI, IDOC, Direct/Batch Input) and, SAP-Script, Smart-forms and Adobe Forms, ALE/IDOC developments, Distribution model configuration, change pointers activation, ABAP proxies. etc.Minimum 2 full life cycle implementations (prior experience defining/implementing solutions across multiple legal entities in a highly complex systems and project environment) including hands-on design and developmentExperience in FIORI, CPI in SAP HANA environment is plus.Experience includes functional specs understanding, Development plan including estimation, technical specs preparation, Coding, and Testing as per SDLC methodologyAbility to analyze key business drivers, then translate the findings into insights and actions, and their implications in the overall businessDemonstrates strong knowledge and application of testing strategies, methodologies and has been responsible for executing unit, integration, and user acceptance testingStrong analytical, problem solving and conceptual skills including the ability to express complex technical concepts in business termsA team player with excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to communicate clearly, ability to work both independently and as part of a teamMonitor KPIs, report any issues and recommend solutions for improvementHighly proficient using Microsoft products (SharePoint, Excel, Word, Outlook).Excellent communication and presentation skills, demonstrated ability to work with different agencies to understand the key business drivers that impact business user satisfaction

title: Data Scientist
job_description: Proven experience in deploying real-time AI/ML models using Google Cloud Platform. · Strong programming skills in Python and PySpark.· Proficiency with SQL and relational databases, data warehouses, and BigQuery.· Experience in scaling marketing-related AI/ML solutions such as cross/upsell, recommended systems, and category propensity.· Experience in deploying and managing Large scale Machine Learning Models is a plus· Expertise with classical ML algorithm like K-NN, LSH, logistic regression, linear regression, SVM, Random forest and clustering.· Good understanding of ML & DL algorithms and frameworks (Scikit-learn,Spacy, Tensorflow/Keras/ PyTorch)· Experience in deep learning Algorithms like MLP, CNN, RNN, LSTMs and GANs, Transformers and LLMs.· Excellent programming skills in Python· Expertise in Google Cloud and operationalization of models using MLOPs.· Experience in scheduling jobs for automated training and inference of AI/ML models using airflow or any other workflow orchestration platform.· Proficiency in collecting data from different data sources, data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering.· Understanding of regression, classification, and unsupervised ML algorithms.· Experience in mentoring junior associates in scaling AI/ML models.· Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.· Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

title: Data Scientist III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...About Our TeamThe Walmart Omni Tech Supply Chain Innovation team researches, identifies, and develops analytical supply chain products that drive cost efficiencies. Our team takes end-to-end ownership in solving complex supply chain problems using technology and data. We're seeking motivated, results-oriented individuals to build innovative products, from concept to deployment.What You'll DoAs a Data Scientist III in Global Tech, you will work with cross-functional teams of engineers, designers, and product managers to build products. You will:Conceptualize, research, and identify gaps in current business processes. Structure ambiguous problems, formulate hypotheses, gather and analyze data, and provide clear recommendations using tools such as BigQuery, Microsoft Power BI, Excel, R, PythonBuild scalable and complex supply chain models and processes to optimize supply chain.Lead the data discovery for complex technical projects while navigating multiple data sourcesDemonstrate a high degree of creativity when developing solutions to improve existing supply chain processes, utilizing methods such as statistical analysis, and optimization.Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solutions and move people and organizations to act.What You'll Bring (Skills Required)Knowledge of retail supply chain and one or more business practices across domains such as product, finance, marketing, technology, business systems.Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. Experience with large dataset mining tools and open-source programming tools (e.g., R, Python).Experience solving network / inventory / transportation optimization problems using integer. Programming.Ability to deconstruct an abstract problem, formulate hypotheses, identify the right-metrics and data sources and conduct detailed analyses to explain the business context.Experience in navigating ambiguity and building rapid business cases/ prototypes to improve business performance.Hands-on experience in conducting advanced analyses to provide recommendation of applicability and efficiency of product features.Experience using the following analytics and reporting tools: Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Excel. About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data scientists and service professionals within Walmart, the world's largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.3 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service, or some code, but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. Being human-led is our true disruption. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, hybrid workWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily virtual, while remaining near the locations Global Tech calls home. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We use our campuses to collaborate and be together in person, as business needs require and for development and networking opportunities.BenefitsBeyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. title: Senior, Data Scientist
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...About Our TeamAs part of the larger People Analytics team, the Research & Analytics team is composed of statisticians, I/O psychologists, data analysts and data scientists who are focused on providing actionable insights and develop AI models to improve the experience of Walmart's associates.At Walmart, we are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our team. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in our People Analytics department, utilizing your expertise in building causal inference machine learning models to drive data-driven decision-making.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and implement advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to analyze large datasets and extract valuable insights.Collaborate with cross-functional teams and Center of Excellence (COE) partners across our Global People function to identify business problems and develop analytical plans to address them.Conduct rigorous statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to uncover patterns and trends in data.Apply Bayesian inference techniques to enhance the accuracy and reliability of predictive models.Utilize your strong problem-solving skills to scope problems and identify quick wins for our customers.Evaluate programs and quantify the return on investment (ROI) to drive data-driven decision-making.Collaborate primarily with the Global People centers of excellence and support our People partners in the business.RequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist, such as in retail or e-commerce.Strong proficiency in building and productionizing and maintaining causal inference machine learning models.Familiarity with Bayesian inference is a strong plus.Experience using Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs) for causal modeling to avoid common pitfalls in causal inference, such as confounding variables and reverse causality.Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.Experience with SQL and handling very large datasetsExperience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.People Analytics experience a plus but not requiredCulture At WalmartAt Walmart, we value diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. We foster an environment that encourages innovation and continuous learning. Our team members are passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of our customers and communities. We believe in empowering our employees and providing them with opportunities for growth and development.At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.‎‎‎You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.‎For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .‎‎Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.‎Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.‎For Information About Benefits And Eligibility, See One.Walmart .‎The annual salary range for this position is $90,000.00-$180,000.00‎Additional Compensation Includes Annual Or Quarterly Performance Bonuses.‎Additional Compensation For Certain Positions May Also Include‎‎ Stock‎‎Minimum Qualifications...Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.Option 1- Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and 3 years' experience in an analytics related field. Option 2- Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and 1 years' experience in an analytics related field. Option 3 - 5 years' experience in an analytics or related field.Preferred Qualifications...Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.Data science, machine learning, optimization models, Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Successful completion of one or more assessments in Python, Spark, Scala, or R, Using open source frameworks (for example, scikit learn, tensorflow, torch), We value candidates with a background in creating inclusive digital experiences, demonstrating knowledge in implementing Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 AA standards, assistive technologies, and integrating digital accessibility seamlessly. The ideal candidate would have knowledge of accessibility best practices and join us as we continue to create accessible products and services following Walmart's accessibility standards and guidelines for supporting an inclusive culture.Primary Location...508 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712, United States of America

title: Data Scientist
company: Arkansas Blue Cross and Blue Shield

Incumbent exercises expert knowledge of available data, key business drivers, statistics, mathematics, and open-source software toolsets to derive relevant insights informing business decision-making. The incumbent regularly engages data mining techniques (data discovery, exploration, extraction, modeling, and evaluation) alongside software engineering tasks (software integration, deployment, and maintenance) to accomplish these responsibilities.RequirementsEDUCATIONBachelor’s degree in Math, Science, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Informatics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Health Information, Epidemiology, Data Analytics, Data Science, Predictive Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Engineering, or Physics required.LICENSING/CERTIFICATIONAny certification specializing in data engineering, big data, data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or statistical analysis from accredited institutions of higher learning. years of experience PhD in an analytical field of study with one (1) year of experienceExperience with the development of data science, machine learning, and/or advanced analytics implementations or preferred.Machine Learning preferred.SkillsArtificial Intelligence (AI), Big Data, Cloud Computing, Computer Coding, Critical Thinking, Machine Learning, Microsoft Power BI, Model Building, Problem necessary to assist understanding and explanation to the model., Identifies key data within available data that increases forecasting of performance., Monitors for data drift within models., Other duties as assigned., Stays abreast on machine learning techniques in the market through training and research.CertificationsSecurity RequirementsThis position is identified as level three (3). title: Data Scientist III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with expertise in supply chain operations. The ideal candidate will have experience in Forecasting, AI/ML predictive models, simulation and MLOPS, as well as a deep understanding of data analytics and statistics. You will be responsible for analyzing large data sets, developing predictive and simulation models, and implementing data-driven solutions to optimize our supply chain operations.About TeamSam's Club is our membership warehouse club, a business model that provides our members with high-quality products at prices that are unrivaled by traditional retail. Sam's Club provides a carefully curated assortment of items, as well as developing and leading technologies and services such as Scan & Go, Club Pickup, and home delivery service in select markets. Sam's Club also provides travel, auto purchasing, pharmacy, optical, hearing aid centers, tire and battery centers, and a portfolio of business operations support services.What You'll DoDevelop data science models for retail & e-commerce.Develop predictive models to forecast demand, inventory levels, and lead times.Implement data-driven solutions to optimize supply chain operations, including automation and optimization algorithmsUtilize simulation tools to model supply chain scenarios and evaluate the impact of proposed changes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvements and cost savings.Create opportunities to develop yourself with end-to-end AI/ML product experience .Develop and implement MLOPS capabilities to continually improve and refine models and algorithms.What You'll BringExperience in Data science, machine learning, optimization models, PhD/Masters in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Operations Research, Simulation, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, EconometricsExperience in Python, Spark, Scala, or R, using open-source frameworks (for example, scikit learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch)Excellent understanding of AI/ML/DL and Statistics, as well as coding proficiency using related open-source libraries and frameworksSignificant proficiency in SQL and languages like Python, PySpark and/or ScalaAbout Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, Hybrid WorkWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.BenefitsBenefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. title: Staff, Data Scientist
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Location: Bentonville, AR or Dallas, TX.Join us in revolutionizing data-driven decision-making in the world's largest company! Walmart Claim Services (WCS) is looking for a talented Staff Data Scientist to support our team of over 550 professional who operate like an internal insurance company, managing claims for our associates and customers across the nation.About UsWCS works closely with our Legal, Safety, & Finance partner and external vendors to provide data insights for informed, data-driven decisions. Our data science and analytics team consist of talented group of data specialists who manage data, develop statistical, machine learning, NLP, Gen AI models/ solutions, and maintain reporting tools, ensuring we remain a world-class business.As a Staff Data Scientist, you will utilize your expertise in data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, and NLP techniques to drive strategic decisions for WCS. You will be at the forefront of implementing models and strategies using A/B testing or Design of Experiments (DOE), tracking business performance, and providing insightful visualizations to support and continuously improve WCS business strategy.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop and Deploy innovative Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Gen AI, and Graph Neural Network (GNN) models using Python/GCP or other modeling tools.Design and conduct A/B Testing and multivariate experiments (DOE), tracking results to provide actionable recommendations to business partners.Develop clear, concise, and powerful data visualizations using BI tools like Power BI or Tableau.Utilize SQL, Python, Google Cloud, MLOps, Tableau, Power BI, R or SAS to prepare data for analysis, modeling, deployment, and reporting.Identify business process gaps and devise analytical solutions to address them.Ideal CandidateA self-starter, able to work independently and overcome obstacles to achieve results.A multi-tasker, capable of managing multiple technical projects while delivering results.A problem solver, with a high degree of intellectual curiosity and solid business acumen.An excellent communicator, able to present significant analysis in a concise manner to key stakeholders.A flexible thinker, comfortable with ambiguity and adept at fact-finding.In joining Walmart's WCS team, you get to be part of a global company that is at the forefront of leveraging data for business insights. This role offers the opportunity to work with complex, large-scale datasets, and cutting-edge technologies, providing a platform for continuous learning and professional growth. Furthermore, Walmart's commitment to innovation makes it an exciting environment for data analysts who want to make a significant impact.Benefits & PerksAt Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. title: (USA) Senior, Data Scientist
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...The Edge Ingress Security team is responsible for defending our eCommerce and corporate web properties from web-based attacks, DDoS attacks, unwanted scripted traffic, and fraudulent behavior.We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to build end to end data infrastructure, pipeline, and machine learning models to detect and mitigate anomalous and fraudulent risks to Walmart web properties.About TeamAt Walmart, we prioritize innovation and data security. Our team is dedicated to maintaining a secure operating environment and preserving the trust of our customers, associates, and stakeholders. We combine a range of services and expertise to prevent fraud, detect threats, and manage digital risk and access. Our focus is on mitigating attack risks, securing cloud transformation, and fostering a culture of security and reliability within our teamWhat You'll DoYour main responsibilities include but are not limited to:Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architectureAssemble large, complex data setsAnalyze large volumes of data to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies indicative of fraudulent behavior. Derive data-driven insights to improve anomaly detection strategies.Build infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and 'big data' technologiesAssess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniquesDesign, develop and deploy custom data models and algorithms to surface anomalous behaviorsDevelop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracyWhat You'll Bring Have a passion for data with exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills  Well versed with Spark, Hadoop, Cloud, Python/Scala and Java, Streaming, Kafka.  Proven track record of at least one programming language and one Database language  Proficient in one of cloud computing platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure)  Experienced in data modeling & data migration protocols  Experience with data warehousing (e.g. Databricks)  Experience with machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques, with a focus on their use for anomaly detection  A strong sense of accountability and self-motivation  Ability to collaborate cross-functionally  Excellent communications skills both written and verbal.  Web application and cyber security domain knowledge is a plus. title: Data Scientist
job_description: Job Title: Data Scientist  Location: Bentonville, AR  Duration: Full-Time  Desired Skills: Machine Learning | Python | SQLJob Description Proven experience in deploying real-time AI/Client models using Google Cloud Platform. Strong programming skills in Python and PySpark. Proficiency with SQL and relational databases, data warehouses, and BigQuery. Experience in scaling marketing-related AI/Client solutions such as cross/upsell, recommended systems, and category propensity. Experience in deploying and managing Large scale Machine Learning Models is a plus Experience in scheduling jobs for automated training and inference of AI/Client models using airflow or any other workflow orchestration platform. Proficiency in collecting data from different data sources, data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering. Understanding of regression, classification, and unsupervised Client algorithms. Experience in mentoring junior associates in scaling AI/Client models. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.
